attributes.action: create a halls of residence for MP's and abolish the second homes allowance.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I propose the government to abolish the second homes allowance, and instead build a Halls of Residence for the MPs.

The Halls of Residence needent be a "shabby" affair, because if the second homes allowance for one year was instead used to build a Halls of Residence, there will be a substantial amount of money availiable for building and furnishing. 

This would reduce the amount of outgoings for the treasury (the RNLI built a "halls of residence" at their college and saved a fortune) and free up money for the government to spend in other areas.

rejection.details: MPs' expenses are a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
